title: spack edit: use execv instead of Executable
body:
TL; DR: `spack edit` could be weird because it relied on `Popen` (via `Executable`), not `execv`

The problem:
- `spack edit` previously used `spack.util.executable` `Executable` objects, and didn't `exec` the editor.
- This meant that Spack was still running while your editor was, and it could lead to weird behavior
- e.g. on Mac OS the builtin `emacs` will quit with "Keyboard interrupt" when you type `Ctrl-g` -- this is obviously not what we want

The fix:
- [x] Fix all this by changing spack.util.editor to use `os.execv` instead of the Spack Executable object
- [x] Add tests to make sure `editor()` works.

This slightly changes the behavior from #10898 (@chissg -- take a look).

Before, if you launched the editor and it exited 1, you'd try the next editor.  Now we'll only do that if there is a problem with `execv`.  I think that is fine, because you could launch `$VISUAL`, do edits, and `exit 1` for perfectly normal reasons, and then you would likely be surprised if Spack immediately went and launched `$EDITOR`.  I am hoping that @chissg was not relying on this behavior for something.
